      • MDPMobile

        public MDPMobile(Activity activity)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity that implements a MYDIGIPASS login button.

      • MDPMobile

        public MDPMobile(Activity activity,
         java.lang.String clientId,
         java.lang.String redirectUri)
        Alternative constructor.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity that implements a MYDIGIPASS login button.
        clientId - Your MYDIGIPASS client ID registered via developer.mydigipass.com.
        redirectUri - Your MYDIGIPASS mobile redirect URI registered via developer.mydigipass.com.

      • setMDPAuthenticationListener

        public void setMDPAuthenticationListener(OnMDPAuthenticationListener mdpAuthenticationListener)
        Sets the MYDIGIPASS authentication listener. This is used to do authentication callbacks.
        Parameters:
        mdpAuthenticationListener - Class that implements the OnMDPAuthenticationListener.
        See Also:
        OnMDPAuthenticationListener

      • authenticate

        public void authenticate(java.lang.String state)
        Performs the authentication. If the app exists on the user's phone, it's going to open the app. If the app is not installed a dialog will ask to install it or to perform the authentication in a mobile browser instead.
        Parameters:
        state - An opaque value used by the client to maintain state between the request and callback, not null

      • authenticate

        public void authenticate(java.lang.String state,
                java.lang.String scope,
                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> passthroughParams)
        Performs the authentication. If the app exists on the user's phone, it's going to open the app. If the app is not installed a dialog will ask to install it or to perform the authentication in a mobile browser instead.
        Parameters:
        state - An opaque value used by the client to maintain state between the request and callback, not null
        scope - Space-delimited values used to determine which MYDIGIPASS user data can be consumed with the OAuth Access Token, may be null
        passthroughParams - Anything extra, may be null

      • openStore

        public void openStore()
        Opens the marketplace place and redirects the user to the MYDIGIPASS app.

      • webFlow

        public void webFlow()
        Detects and handles an incoming intent triggered by the MYDIGIPASS website. It enables authentication via the user's browser when the MYDIGIPASS App is not installed. If it's not an authentication request, this method does nothing.

      • handleResult

        public void handleResult(int requestCode,
                int resultCode,
                Intent data)
        Checks and handles the incoming intent onActivityResult. Use this method in the OnActivityResult callback.
        Parameters:
        requestCode - requestCode
        resultCode - resultCode
        data - Intent from the MYDIGIPASS app

      • isMdpInstalled

        public boolean isMdpInstalled()
        Checks if the MYDIGIPASS App is installed on the device.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • canMdpHandleIntent

        @Deprecated
public boolean canMdpHandleIntent(Intent intent)
        Deprecated. 
        Checks if there are activities that can run the specific intent. As most of the MYDIGIPASS users now use at least version 2.0 where app2app is implemented, we don't need to check anymore if the intent is possible.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • canHandleResult

        public boolean canHandleResult(Intent intent)
        Checks if the incoming intent is coming from the MDP app.
        Parameters:
        intent - data intent coming from the onActivityResult method.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • setPassthroughParams

        public void setPassthroughParams(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Takes a map of key/values and adds them to the oauth request. When a reserved keyword is used this throws an MDPException.
        Parameters:
        parameters - map with key values
        Throws:
        MDPException
        See Also:
        for a list of reserved keywords.

        public void setContext(Activity activity)

        activity -
